thread.title: Collection: Apprenticeship standards

title: Collection: Apprenticeship standards
text:
For more information about the reforms, funding and the trailblazers, please refer to the guidance for trailblazers . Searching for an apprenticeship 
Employers can use the find apprenticeship training service to search for suitable apprenticeships and identify approved training providers who can deliver that training. 
The service contains details of training providers who currently offer apprenticeships. It will be updated in 2017 to reflect the new register of apprenticeship training providers. Apprenticeship standards approved for delivery 
Each apprenticeship standard has an assessment plan produced by ‘trailblazers’ (employer-led groups that are developing the standards). 
Standards showing (approved for delivery) include an approved assessment plan and are ready for employers and training organisations to use. 
The apprenticeship funding bands page lists the apprenticeship standards that have an approved assessment plan and funding cap.
